overview: The purpose of this measure is to "appropriate moneys to satisfy various claims against the State, its officers, or its employees, including claims for judgments against the State, settlements, and other miscellaneous claims" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). Based on testimony from the Department of the Attorney General, the measure has been amended to include "two additional claims that have been resolved since this measure was introduced" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). Additionally, amendments were made correcting the description of two claims to reflect they were resolved by judgment rather than settlement.
appropriations: The Department of the Attorney General testimony requests the bill be amended to increase the appropriation by $70,514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) for two new claims to be paid from the general fund. This brings the total appropriation request to $6,569,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt). The updated request includes an appropriation of $5,229,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) from the general fund and $1,340,000.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) from departmental funds.
agency_impact: In addition to previously noted support, the Committee on Ways and Means "received written comments in support of this measure from the... Attorney General, and Department of Hawaiian Home Lands" (HB990_SD1_.HTM.txt). The Department of Education reiterated its support, stating the bill allows the Department to "focus on its core mission of educating Hawaii's students" (HB0990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt).
economic_impact: The Committee on Judiciary finds that "timely passage of this measure will minimize the State's obligation to pay interest on the amounts owed by the State" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). This is in addition to promoting financial responsibility and allowing state agencies to focus on their core missions. Efficient settlement of claims is intended to "promote financial responsibility" (HB990_SD1_.HTM.txt).
policy_impact: The measure has been amended by "Correcting the description of the claims for Billy Peter v. Anne E. Lopez; and Child Evangelism Fellowship of Hawaii, Inc. v. Hawaii State Department of Education; to indicate that the claims were resolved by judgment, rather than settlement" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). The committee also amended the measure by "Changing the effective date to April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). These amendments reflect procedural and legislative adjustments to the bill as it moves through the legislative process.
revenue_sources: Testimony from the Attorney General updates the appropriation request to include $5,229,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) "allocated among twenty claims to be paid from the general fund." The remainder of the total appropriation is requested from departmental funds. The two newly added claims are to be paid from the general fund.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The measure has been amended by "Adding $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt) for the settlement of Lisa Ann Daguro v. State of Hawaii." It was also amended by "Adding funding to cover a miscellaneous claim of $514.00 (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt) for the reissuance of an outdated check that was misplaced or lost." Testimony confirms these two new claims total $70,514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) and are to be paid from the general fund. The total number of claims in the bill is now twenty-three, with an appropriation request totaling $6,569,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the addition of two claims totaling $70,514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt), increasing the total appropriation request to $6,569,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) across twenty-three claims. The bill was amended to correct the description of two claims from "settlement" to "judgment" as requested by the Attorney General (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). A new economic benefit was identified, as timely passage "will minimize the State's obligation to pay interest on the amounts owed by the State" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt), and the bill's effective date was changed to "facilitate further discussion" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_.HTM.txt). Support for the measure was also noted from the Attorney General and the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands.
